column4: Anyone know of a CLI tool to convert date/time from one timezone to another? (Not the current time just any input time)

I don't that's what I'm looking for. Basically, I want to convert a date that I input (with an input timezone) and get it in the output timezone, (There flags will be passed to the command). Essentially for things like Ubuntu Classroom. It says 1700 UTC, I want to know when it is for me. And if someone asks me for a time, I want to be able to convert my local time to theirs.
mmm  let me check hold on
mm this is proving a bit tuff... I know you can convert UTC to local time and date
there is most likely already something for what you want to do I just cant find one ...yet
you might want to check with perl commands  for this as well
perl? Got it directly from the CLI thanks to erUSUL. :)
oh ok ... i need to pay more attention  :)
It's alright. Very hard to follow discussions on chanells like these....
for sure... I know that you can do some time conversions with perl  though ...let me see if i can find a man page or something
I've not written in perl, so I wouldn't know. But the date libraries in most languages can do this pretty easily...
ok cool... I will stop searching  :)
